metadata.title: CVE-2015-3238 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The _unix_run_helper_binary function in the pam_unix module in Linux-PAM(aka pam) before 1.2.1, when unable to directly access passwords, allowslocal users to enumerate usernames or cause a denial of service (hang) viaa large password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-cracklib - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules-bin - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-runtime - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam0g - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pam package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1').
